author: J. Christopher Alexander
quote: A static design is just that, static. And code alone is simply a mix of characters. It is the skilled, artful engineer who leverages an array of technical competencies to deliver the ux magic stakeholders and consumers expect.

author: Innovation leads one to see the new in the old and distinguishes the ingenious from the ingenuous.
Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
Simple is hard. Easy is harder. Invisible is hardest.
The main goal is not to complicate the already difficult life of the consumer.
The only intuitive interface is the nipple. After that it's all learned.
As far as the customer is concerned, the interface is the product.

What makes people passionate, pure and simple, is great experiences. If they have great experience with your product and they have great experiences with your service, they’re going to be passionate about your brand, they’re going to be committed to it. That’s how you build that kind of commitment.
Don't make something unless it's both necessary and useful. But if it is both necessary and useful, don't hesitate to make it beautiful.
A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools.
At the end of the day it is how the user remembers the experience. Focus on key experiences.
